title: NASA Confirms DART Mission Impact Changed Asteroid’s Motion in Space
summary: Analysis of data obtained over the past two weeks by NASA’s Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) investigation team shows the spacecraft's kinetic impact with its target asteroid, Dimorphos, successfully altered the asteroid’s orbit. This marks humanity’s first time purposely changing the motion of a celestial object and the first full-scale dem

title: El impacto de DART cambió el movimiento de un asteroide en el espacio
summary: El análisis de los datos obtenidos en las últimas dos semanas por el equipo de investigación de la Prueba de redireccionamiento del asteroide doble (DART, por sus siglas en inglés) de la NASA muestra que el impacto cinético de la nave espacial contra su asteroide objetivo, Dimorphos, alteró con éxito la órbita del asteroide. Esto marca la primera v

title: Inmarsat wins $980 million U.S. Navy contract for global communications services
summary: Inmarsat Government won a 10-year contract valued at $980 million to provide broadband satellite and terrestrial communications services to the U.S. Navy.

title: ExoTrail wins contract to demonstrate orbital transfer for French agencies
summary: ExoTrail won a contract worth “several million euros” to perform an orbital logistics mission for French institutions.

title: Solestial closes $10 million round led by Airbus Ventures
summary: Solestial, a Tempe, Arizona company focused on solar energy for space applications, closed a $10 million seed funding round led by Airbus Ventures.

title: Space companies face difficult investment environment
summary: Rising interest rates are making it more difficult for space startups to raise money, some warn, forcing them to seek alternative sources of funding.

title: SpaceX deploys two of six C-band satellites Intelsat is launching this year
summary: SpaceX Oct. 8 successfully deployed the first two of seven satellites Intelsat needs to clear C-band spectrum in the United States, keeping the operator on course to launch all but one of them before the end of this year.

title: Former SES CEO joins megaconstellation startup E-Space
summary: Former SES CEO Karim Michel Sabbagh has returned to the space industry to oversee strategy in Europe and the Middle East for E-Space, the connectivity startup plotting a network of hundreds of thousands of satellites.

title: Launch on demand: If satellites are shot down, will Space Force be ready to restock?
summary: Responsive space launch capabilities are gaining more attention as world events that underline the strategic value of satellites also makes them more attractive targets for adversaries.

title: United Launch Alliance's debut Vulcan mission slips to 2023 -CEO
summary: United Launch Alliance has pushed the debut launch of its new Vulcan rocket to early 2023 at the request of one of its customers, the company's chief executive said, further delaying a benchmark mission crucial to the Boeing-Lockheed joint venture's launch business.
